text: Catholicos Dertad I was the Catholicos of the Armenian Apostolic Church between 741 and 764. According to the historian Kirakos Ganjaketsi, Dertad was from Otmus village and was a 'modest, blessed man, radiant in all virtue'. He reigned in a time of relative peace with a break in the Arab invasions. Category:Catholicoi of Armenia Catholicos Dertad I Category:Year of birth unknown Category:8th-century Oriental Orthodox archbishops
title: Dertad I
